About Face recognition

Know more

Face recognition

This is a web app that identifies faces in a photo.

Using an API from clarifai it is able to identify and show faces. You can create your own user and keep track of the number of images you have used.

The web app

The frontend of this project was written with react. The backend is written in JS. Here is where the API is used and where all the information is processed. A posgreSQL database is used to handle the user information.

See Live Source Code frontend Source Code backend

Instructions for Use

  1. Registration/Login
    • If it is your first visit, register.
    • If you are already registered, proceed to log in.
  2. Uploading image:
    • Obtain the link of your image and press the button.
    • Ensure the link is valid; note that no all links are compatible with the API.
    • If using an image from Google:
      1. Left-click on the image.
      2. In the new window that opens, right-click and copy the image address.
      3. Use this copied URL for processing.
    • It is crucial to left-click the image before copying its URL; otherwise, the method may fail.
By following these steps, you can easily utilize the tool to process your images.

More about this project

Two examples are displayed in the image. The top one following the instructions from above and the bottom one not following them. Even when the image is the same, the API may have issues to work properly in some instances. This project uses a free version of render to store frontend, backend and database. Some inconveniences include:

  • Slow response from the website.
  • Database of users is erased after 90 days.
